Terminal Messenger API¶

Terminal Messenger Server¶

Main logic of server program.

async msg.server.handler(reader, writer)¶

Async logic of handler.

async msg.server.main(port=1337)¶

Async logic of server.

msg.server.parse_create_chat(args: list)¶

Parse arguments for chat settings.

msg.server.send_preparing(response: Message, chat: Chat | None = None) → str¶

Handle for sending command.

msg.server.start(port=1337)¶

Start the server.

Terminal Messenger Common¶

Description of all objects using in project.

class msg.common.Chat(name, creator, limit=None, security_mode=False, password=None, autoright='Editor')¶

Describe parameters of text chat.

Base characteristics:

  • Name of chat

  • Chat creator

  • People limit in group (None for No-limit mode)

  • Security mode: On/Off

  • Password (for Security mode)

Dynamic parameters:

  • List of users in chat and their rights

  • AutoRight (rights of users, who join chat first time)

  • Users in chat IRL

  • Favourite messages and their count

  • Message Stream and its count

Format of objects in list of users in Chat:

  • user: User

  • rights: Rights

check_Rights(user, right: Rights)¶

Rights check.

check_password(password_to_check)¶

Authorize check.

set_autoright(autoright)¶

Set up of autoright.

Available only for the chat administrator

set_limit(limit)¶

Set up of people limit.

Available only for the chat administrator

If count of people online IRL more than new limit, return LimitSetupError

set_security_mode(mode, password=None)¶

Set up of security mode.

Available only for the chat administrator

exception msg.common.LimitSetupError¶

Limit setup error exception.

class msg.common.Message(*, text, mode=None, style=None, sender, msg_ID: int, reply_ID=None)¶

Describe parameters of message in chat.

Base characteristics:

  • Text of message

  • Mode of message

  • Style of message

  • Message Sender

  • Message ID

Dynamic parameters:

  • Reply ID

  • Favourite

set_favourite()¶

Set up of 'favourites' label.

exception msg.common.NoAccessError¶

Access exception.

class msg.common.Rights(value)¶

Rights.

exception msg.common.TerminalError¶

Base class for special Exceptions.

exception msg.common.UnvalidChatError¶

Access exception.

class msg.common.User(user_id, username)¶

Describe parameters of user.

Base characteristics:

  • User’s ID (based on your MAC-address of computer)

  • User’s name

Dynamic paremeters:

  • List of chats and user’s rights for each chat

  • Current chat

Format of objects in list of chats in User:

  • user: Chat

  • rights: Rights

add_to_chat(user_id, name)¶

Add user to chat.

Available only if you are a chat administrator

add_to_favourites(msg_id: int)¶

Add message to Favourites.

create_chat(name: str, limit: int | None = None, security_mode: bool = False, password=None, autoright: Rights = Rights.EDITOR)¶

Create new chat.

delete_chat(name)¶

Delete chat.

Available only if you are a chat administrator

exit_chat()¶

Exit current chat.

info_chat(name)¶

Take information about chat.

open_chat(name)¶

Open existing chat.

quit_chat(name)¶

Quit chat.

send(*, msg: str, mode: str | None = None, style: str | None = None, reply_id: int | None = None) → Message¶

Send message to chat.

show_chatlist()¶

Show list of user’s chats.

update_chat(name, limit: int = -1, autoright: Rights | None = None, security_mode=None, password=None)¶

Update chat.

msg.common.arg2Rights(arg)¶

Args changes to Rights.

Terminal Messenger Client¶

Main logic of client program.

class msg.client.clientCmd(socket, *args, **kwargs)¶

Cmd class.

do_EOF(args)¶

Stop game.

do_add_to_chat(args)¶

Add someone in the chat.

do_add_to_favourites(args)¶

Add message to favorites.

do_create_chat(args)¶

Create chat.

do_delete_chat(args)¶

Delete chat.

do_exit(args)¶

Exit chat.

do_info_chat(args)¶

Show information about the chat: number and names of participants.

do_open_chat(args)¶

Open chat.

do_quit_chat(args)¶

Quit chat, leaving chat without acces for the client.

do_reply(args)¶

Reply to the message.

do_send(args)¶

Send the message.

do_show_chatlist(args)¶

Show a list of chats available to the client.

do_update_chat(args)¶

Update chat settings.

emptyline()¶

Hide previous commands.

msg.client.msg_receiver(client)¶

Receiving messages.

msg.client.start_client(username, host='localhost', port=1337)¶

Start client.
